item.title: Freestyle Adult Masters Program
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Isaacs
item.description: Register Written up in the Denver Post as a sure bet for adult skiers looking to continue to improve their skills and ability to ski difficult terrain, the Freestyle Masters is a unique adult ski program. The program was formed in 1989 and is going strong with over 35 members. The Freestyle Masters will teach... View Article
item.content:encoded:
Register

Written up in the Denver Post as a sure bet for adult skiers looking to continue to improve their skills and ability to ski difficult terrain, the Freestyle Masters is a unique adult ski program. The program was formed in 1989 and is going strong with over 35 members. The Freestyle Masters will teach you the skills necessary to become a stronger skier and challenge you daily. The coaching staff consists of former Pro Mogul Tour and US Ski Team athletes who know what it takes to develop all mountain and mogul skills. While you will learn new skills on moderate terrain, the coaches will progress you to more difficult terrain as you become more proficient. Skiing with the freestyle masters means you will always have a group of ski enthusiasts to ski with and ski hard.  To sum up the freestyle masters a quote from Coach Mark Kahre: “masters are focused on becoming the best skiers they can be. the passion we share for the sport has created a very close knit unit. We combine the social aspect with expert instruction. I am not aware of any other program like this.”

Ideal candidate- strong intermediate skier who loves the challenge of skiing moguls and is in good physical condition. Coaching is offered three times a week, since proficiency can best be attained with regular training over a whole season.

One-day Freestyle Masters:

DATES & TIMES: The one-day FS Masters train one day per week. FS Masters meets Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays, November 25, 2015 through March 27, 2016. Program fees include a Winter Park/Mary Jane season pass.

COST: $1230 on or before 10/15/2015. $100 late fee applies after 10/15/2015.

Freestyle Masters Unlimited:

DATES & TIMES: Unlimited training days throughout the season. FS Masters meets Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays, November 25, 2015 through March 27, 2016. Program fees include a Winter Park/Mary Jane season pass. A

COST: $1630 on or before 10/15/2015. $100 late fee applies after 10/15/2015.

Freestyle Masters Resources Competition Center General Handbook 14-15

item.title: Freeski Team – Park+Pipe
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Isaacs
item.description: AGES 12+ Register The Winter Park Freeski Team has produced top level athletes including 2014 Olympian Lyman Currier and the up and coming youngster Birk Irving. The Freeski Team – Park+Pipe is the program for the athletic skier looking to improve their skills in park and pipe. The Freeski Park + Pipe programs are offered... View Article
item.content:encoded:
AGES 12+

Register

The Winter Park Freeski Team has produced top level athletes including 2014 Olympian Lyman Currier and the up and coming youngster Birk Irving.

The Freeski Team – Park+Pipe is the program for the athletic skier looking to improve their skills in park and pipe. The Freeski Park + Pipe programs are offered as a 1-day, 2-day, 3-day and Full-Time program. Great park skiers must have exceptional skiing skills, focusing on progression, safety, and fun. The Freeski team will train Rerailer, Railyard and Dark Territory, but will spend majority of their training time in the larger park, Dark Territory. These are the parks where athletes will focus on sliding boxes and rails and furthering their air awareness skills in half-pipe and slopestyle. This program is a great place to learn and polish up on their skills needed for park and pipe. It also offers you the opportunity to do a wide variety of competitions (Slopestyle/Halfpipe). It is required that you be on the 2-day program or full time program to be on the competitive traveling team. The competitive team will work on goal setting, sports psychology, strength and flexibility. The majority of the competitions are USASA around the state. Some athletes will also attend some other competitions like the Revolution Tour, and the Aspen Open Park & Pipe open events. These events are AFP events (Association of Freesking Professionals). Athletes will need to purchase a USASA license http://www.usasa.org, and register for AFP recognition at http://afpworldtour.com for all other non USASA events. These are the events needed for the aspiring athlete who has dreams of the Dew Tour, X Games , or Olympics. To join this program athletes are expected to be able to hit 3.1 (first jump) in Dark Territory safely and in a controlled manner. Summer training camps at Steamboat Springs water ramps and Windell’s at Mt. Hood in June for on snow are available to further the individual’s training goals (these camps are not included in the program fee). AGE/ABILITY EXPECTATIONS: * Recommended age 12 or based on ability * At minimum, riders should have the basic of rails and jumping * Must be a blue-blk/expert skier * Must be willing to spend majority of time in the terrain parks * Must be able to jump 3-1 in Dark Territory in a safe controlled manner.

DATES & TIMES: 1-day Park + Pipe: Nov. 21 2015 thru March 27, 2016. Saturdays 9am-3:30pm. 2-day Park + Pipe: Nov. 21, 2015 thru March 27, 2016. Saturdays and Sundays 9am-3:30pm. 3-day Park + Pipe: Nov. 21 2015 thru March 27, 2016. Friday-Saturday-Sunday 9am-3:30pm.  Fulltime Academy Middle School:  Nov. 21 thru April 10, 2016. Tuesday & Thursday 1-4pm Friday-Sunday 9am-3:30pm. Fulltime Academy High School: Nov. 3 2015 thru April 10, 2016 Tuesday-Thursdays 1-4. Friday-Saturday-Sunday. 9am-3:30pm COST: 1-day Park + Pipe: $1530, includes a Winter Park/Mary Jane Season Pass  2-day Park + Pipe: $2130, includes a Winter Park/Mary Jane Season Pass 3-day Park + Pipe:  $2475, includes a Winter Park/Mary Jane Season Pass

Fulltime Academy Middle School: $4030, Includes Winter Park/Mary Jane Pass; access to Grand Park Rec Center for Competition Center guided fitness activities; Sports Science program and directed workouts during the week.

Fulltime Academy High School: $4430, Includes Winter Park/Mary Jane Pass; access to Grand Park Rec Center for Competition Center guided fitness activities; Sports Science program and directed workouts during the week.

Program Fees include the Holiday Camp Dec. 26 – 31st from 9am – 3pm. 

Athletes interested in being considered for the Fulltime Academy are required to complete the Fulltime Academy application and submit to Laurie Mooney for review at lmooney@winterparkresort.com

There is an additional $200 work deposit which is refunded upon completion of volunteer work hours.  Click here for more details.

item.title: Freeski Team – Big Mountain
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Isaacs
item.description: AGES 12+ Register The Winter Park Big Mountain program is geared towards focused Big Mountain skiers/athletes who have the love for the mountains, Big Mtn terrain, environment and those who are interested in competitions on a high level. Athletes in this program travel to regional, national and potentially international competitions. Athletes are introduced to ski... View Article
item.content:encoded:
AGES 12+

Register

The Winter Park Big Mountain program is geared towards focused Big Mountain skiers/athletes who have the love for the mountains, Big Mtn terrain, environment and those who are interested in competitions on a high level. Athletes in this program travel to regional, national and potentially international competitions. Athletes are introduced to ski mountaineering concepts such as snow safety, avalanche awareness and line selections, in addition to goal setting, video analysis and sports psychology. There is an emphasis on skill development: developing general freeski ability, focused freeskiing, practice drills. There will be some off snow training available where we use trampolines to focus on air awareness skills and basic acrobatics in relation to freeskiing. As always we have fun, practice good sportsmanship and team unity will be incorporated. This team showcases fantastic energy and a special camaraderie between athletes not found on any other team in the region. *Competitions: Athletes must purchase an IFSA license to be eligible for comps. Athletes in this program compete in JETA and IFSA events such as; IFSA events are for ages 12-17 year olds & 18 year olds who are still in high school. **Competition Travel: Generally the Big Mtn program attends 5+ week long competitions per winter as a team. (See Big Mtn Comp calendar online, usually updated by November 1st). All competition registration fees and travel are an additional expense to each athlete who travels. The Winter Park program offers the best value in the Rocky Mountain region.

AGE/ABILITY EXPECTATIONS:

  • Must be 12 years old by 12/31/2015.
  • Must be an expert skier
  • Must be willing to hike and ski variable terrain
  • DATES & TIMES:
  • Saturday 1 day program Nov 21, 2015 thru April 3, 2016. Meets 9-3:30pm.
  • Saturday – Sunday 2-day program Nov 21, 2015 thru April 3, 2016. Meets 9-3:30pm. · 1-day Big Mtn.: $1530* includes the Winter Park/Mary Jane season pass. *$100 late fee after 10/15/2015. The 2 Day Freeski program fees include the Freeski  Big Mountain Holiday Camp  will be held at Wolf Creek January 2&3, 2016
  • Team Jacket for the upcoming 16-17 season (For Travel Team athletes only) Enroll by October 15th to secure your team jacket size Big Mountain Team Resources

item.title: Devo Freeski Team
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Isaacs
item.description: AGES 10+ Register The Devo Freeski Team is a new addition to the Freeski team providing the younger skier the opportunity to get in on the action of slopestyle, half pipe, and big mountain. The program focuses on fundamentals influenced by the terrain parks and demanding terrain offered at Winter Park and Mary Jane.  These... View Article
item.content:encoded:
AGES 10+

Register

The Devo Freeski Team is a new addition to the Freeski team providing the younger skier the opportunity to get in on the action of slopestyle, half pipe, and big mountain. The program focuses on fundamentals influenced by the terrain parks and demanding terrain offered at Winter Park and Mary Jane.  These young skiers spend most of their time in the smaller parks (Rerailer-Ashcat) learning the basic skills of sliding rails and boxes and proper form for jumping and learning air awareness. It is also a great place for these athletes to learn how to set and accomplish their goals.

While they will spend the majority of their time in the parks, when the snow permits, they will ski the more advanced terrain to help improve their all mountain skiing abilities.  This is a great start for the aspiring younger freeskier that wants to learn terrain park skills before joining the competitive Freeski Team.

Devo Freeski athletes will be encouraged to try the fun, local competition, KING of The GROMS (KOG) and with a coach’s recommendation the USASA event around the state.  Athletes doing any USASA events will need to register for a license at http://www.usasa.org.

AGE/ABILITY EXPECTATIONS: *recommended age 10 years old by 12/31/2015  *must be blue-black skier *must be willing to ski majority of the time in the parks+pipe

 

DATES & TIMES: Dec 5, 2015 through March 20, 2016 Saturdays or Sundays 9am-3:30pm

COST: 1-day Devo: $1305* includes the Winter Park/Mary Jane season pass. 2 day Devo $1980* includes the Winter Park/Mary Jane season pass.

There is an additional work deposit fee of $200 which is refunded upon completion of volunteer work hours. Click here for details.

Freeski Team Devo Resources Competition Center Handbook 15-16

King of the Grommets -January 23rd and March 19th, 2016

Compete in the Re-railer Terrain Park to be declared the King of the Grommets! Open to the first 100 competitors, so pre-registration is recommended. Ages 15 and under are $35 with advance purchase.  Format: Best of 2 runs determines final score. Judging will be based on overall impression Click here to register

item.title: Alpine U21 Team
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Isaacs
item.description: Register AGES 19-20 The U21 Team is for athletes who ski at a high level, have a great attitude and love to compete. This program gives access to those who can make it up for a long weekend, spend their holidays and spring breaks at Winter Park, and plan to travel with the team to... View Article
item.content:encoded:
Register

AGES 19-20

The U21 Team is for athletes who ski at a high level, have a great attitude and love to compete. This program gives access to those who can make it up for a long weekend, spend their holidays and spring breaks at Winter Park, and plan to travel with the team to events all over Colorado. The goal for these athletes is to excel at the Smartwool and FIS races without sacrificing good fundamentals and tactics. To accommodate the commitment of the U21 athletes the program is offered part time (Friday,Saturday, and Sunday) or as a fulltime program (Tuesday thru Sunday). See Fulltime page for details on the fulltime program.

DATES: Nov. 20, 2015 thru April 10, 2016. Program Fees include the Thanksgiving Camp November 24th & 25th and the Alpine Holiday Camp December 27th – 31st.

Meets Saturday and Sunday from 8:30am-3:30pm and Fridays from 9am-3:30pm. Fridays are optional for Front Range skiers.

COST: $2680 includes Winter Park/Mary Jane Season Pass. $100 late fee for registrations received after 10/15/2015. There is an additional work deposit fee of $400 which is refunded upon completion of volunteer work hours. Click here for details.

 

Team Jacket  for the upcoming 16-17 season Enroll by October 15th to secure your team jacket size.

AGES 14-15

Register

Our young athletes are maturing and everyone is getting stronger and faster.  We will continue to emphasize fundamental work as they mature, utilizing creative drills in and out of the gates to test and teach the athletes how to “be their own best coach!” Always a great social group, the team travels to events including Smartwool USSA Scored Races, U16 Championship Qualifiers and either the Divisional U16 Championships (Council Cup) or the Regional U16 Championships. To accommodate the commitment of the U16’s, our program is offered as part time (Friday, Saturday and Sunday) or as full time program (Tuesday thru Sunday). item.content:encoded:
AGES 12-13

Register

This group of athletes is a dynamic team environment that continues to use the whole mountain to enhance their fundamentals. These strong skiers will be involved in competitions throughout the Rockies, racing in USSA Age Class events, U14 Super G events, Championship Qualifiers and Regional (U14 Championships) or Divisional (Council Cup) Championship events. A stronger commitment to the sport by the athlete is part of the growth of U14’s. This program is offered Friday, Saturday and, Sundays plus holiday camp. U14’s will also be introduced to physical conditioning and sports psychology throughout the season. Full-time age class training is available Tuesday through Sunday. See the full-time information page for details.

DATES: Nov. 20, 2015 thru April 10, 2016. Program fees include the Thanksgiving Camp November 24th and 25th and the Alpine Holiday Camp December 27th – 31st.

Meets Saturday and Sunday from 8:30am-3:30pm and Fridays from 9am-3:00pm. Fridays are optional for U14 athletes, but strongly encouraged.

item.title: Alpine U12 Team
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Isaacs
item.description: AGES 10-11 Register The U12 age group is usually the first or second step of the development ladder for alpine racers at Winter Park. Following scientific studies and the USSA Alpine Training System, athletes will work as a team in developing all mountain skiing skills, building tremendous confidence. Creativity and fun are the goals of... View Article
item.content:encoded:
AGES 10-11

Register

The U12 age group is usually the first or second step of the development ladder for alpine racers at Winter Park. Following scientific studies and the USSA Alpine Training System, athletes will work as a team in developing all mountain skiing skills, building tremendous confidence. Creativity and fun are the goals of training using directed and undirected free skiing, gate drills, and full length training. The competitions of the U12 group consist of at home events such as “The Raging Age Class Team Series,” the divisional Age Class events and specific U12 USSA races. The fundamentals of Giant Slalom and Slalom are the focus throughout the season and a special Holiday Camp is part of the fun for the U12’s!

DATES: Nov. 20, 2015 thru April 10, 2016. Program fees include the Alpine Holiday Camp December 27th – 31st.

Meets Friday (optional 9am to 3pm) Saturdays and Sundays from 8:30am-3:30pm.

COST: $2580 includes Winter Park/Mary Jane Season Pass. $100 late fee for registrations received after 10/15/2015. There is an additional work deposit fee of $400 which is refunded upon completion of volunteer hours. Click here for details.

item.title: Alpine U10 Team
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Isaacs
item.description: AGES 8-9 Register The U10 age group is usually the first step towards “Fun”damental skill building and learning about racing. This group of skiers will learn the skills necessary to navigate the mountain.  These free-skiing skills will build a tremendous amount of confidence. In turn, they will be able to bring this confidence into structured gate... View Article
item.content:encoded:
AGES 8-9

Register

The U10 age group is usually the first step towards “Fun”damental skill building and learning about racing. This group of skiers will learn the skills necessary to navigate the mountain.  These free-skiing skills will build a tremendous amount of confidence. In turn, they will be able to bring this confidence into structured gate training and racing environments. Throughout the season the U10 age group will have skills based progressions preparing them for gates and drill courses while setting them up for success as they move through the alpine pipeline.  The competitions of the U10 group consist of home events such as “The Raging Age Class Team Series,” specific U12/U10 USSA events and Youth Ski League events.

Scientific studies and the USSA Alpine Training System (ATS) suggest training 2-3 days per week is ideal for this phase athlete.  Our addition of Friday training allows us to more closely follow the ATS.  All of our training will focus on fundamental skills, emphasizing fun, basic agility balance and coordination.

DATES: Nov. 20, 2015 thru April 10, 2016. Includes the Alpine Holiday Camp December 27th – 31st.

Meets Fridays (optional 9am-3pm), Saturdays and Sundays from 8:30am-3:30pm.

COST: $2380 includes Winter Park/Mary Jane Season Pass. $100 late fee for registrations received after 10/15/2015. There is an additional work deposit fee of $400 which is refunded after completion of volunteer work hours. Click here for details.

Team Jacket for the upcoming 16-17 season Enroll by October 15th to secure your team jacket size!

item.title: Alpine Team Discovery
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Isaacs
item.description: AGES 6-13 Register Team Discovery is a Saturday training program that provides budding young ski racers the start they need to become great skiers. Our goal is to develop solid all-around skiing skills by using a variety of drills and progressions taking advantage of all the mountain’s terrain. Team Discovery is an appropriate stepping stone... View Article
item.content:encoded:
AGES 6-13

Register

Team Discovery is a Saturday training program that provides budding young ski racers the start they need to become great skiers. Our goal is to develop solid all-around skiing skills by using a variety of drills and progressions taking advantage of all the mountain’s terrain. Team Discovery is an appropriate stepping stone from ATP Devo, NASTAR recreational racing and Ski School’s Fish Programs into the entry level USSA (US Ski Association) Youth Ski League series races. Strong skiers that can ski all of the terrain on the mountain but have never been in a racing or a teaching program can also start here. Skiers are grouped by age and their ability during the first weeks of the season, and ski with the same professional coaches throughout the season for consistency and individual attention.

DATES: Saturdays, Nov. 28, 2015 thru Mar. 26, 2016. Team Discovery fees include the Holiday Camp December 27th – 31st. Meets 8:30am-3:30pm.

COST: $1305 includes Winter Park/Mary Jane Season Pass and Competition Center. $100 late fee for registrations received after 10/15/2015. There is an additional work deposit fee of $200 which is refunded upon completion of volunteer work hours. Click here for details.

item.title: Alpine Fulltime Academy
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Isaacs
item.description: The Winter Park Alpine Team is a leader in providing the environment for athletes to reach their fullest potential.  In the last few seasons: Andrea Arnold won the Overall Smartwool Series Title in 2014. Andrea Arnold attended the Junior World Championships in 2015 and was named to the CZE National Team. 3.Noah Riemenschneider represented Winter... View Article
item.content:encoded:
The Winter Park Alpine Team is a leader in providing the environment for athletes to reach their fullest potential.  In the last few seasons:

  1. Andrea Arnold won the Overall Smartwool Series Title in 2014.
  2. Andrea Arnold attended the Junior World Championships in 2015 and was named to the CZE National Team.

3.Noah Riemenschneider represented Winter Park and the USA at the CanAm races in Mt. Tremblant.

4.Several U14s and U16s represented Winter Park at their Regional Championships.

5.Taylor Grauer was named to the University of New Mexico NCAA Team and Tori McVicker was named to the University of Alaska NCAA Team.

6.Sean Horner who as of 2015 is part of the Winter Park coaching staff was named to the NCAA All-American Team.

7.Chris Acosta (FIS Coach) was named to the NCAA All-American Team 6 times.

8.Storm Klaumhaus, Clara Hathorne and Adam Freeman were invited to the USSA Team Academy.

The fulltime program has consistently developed members of the United States Ski Team, Junior World Championships competitors, NCAA All-Americans and numerous Junior Olympic medalists.

The Fulltime Alpine Team is a year-around highly intensive program dedicated to the serious, motivated and experienced racer. Our program offers a forum where dedicated athletes can achieve their highest aspirations in sport; while at the same time not forgetting our program philosophy of “to achieve ones’ highest potential as an athlete, person, and competitor”. The team trains regularly September through April with several optional summer camps and projects both on and off snow. Participants also take part in supervised dryland sessions throughout the entire year.

Winter training takes place in the afternoons on Tuesdays through Thursdays, and all day Fridays through Sundays. (East Grand Middle School students train the aforementioned  days except for Wednesdays.) Middle school and high school athletes enroll in the East Grand School District or alternative education programs where schedules are arranged for core classes to take place in the morning, and student/athletes are transported to the ski area at lunch time for afternoon training. East Grand is on a 4-day school week, so skiers have a full day of training on Friday – it doesn’t get any better!

Post graduate athletes will have the opportunity to train on weekday mornings for more individually focused sessions. On-snow training in Colorado begins in late October off-site and the first weekend of November at Winter Park. Training takes place mainly on our FIS  homologated race trails, but we have access to a variety of venues all over the mountain to simulate other venue’s environments.

The Winter Park Competition Center Fulltime Academy requires advance approval from the Alpine Director. Commitment and attitude are the most important attributes we’re looking for; with dedication and a positive outlook, skiing performance will take care of itself. In addition to the program registration, athletes interested in being considered for the Fulltime Academy are required to complete the application and submit to Mike Bowman, Alpine Director for review at mbowman@winterparkresort.com.

DATES: Nov. 1st, 2015 – April 10th, 2016. Program fees include Thanksgiving Camp November 24th & 25th and the Alpine Holiday Camp, December 27th – 31st.

COST: Middle School (U14) (5 day FT program) $4180* High School (U16 and Up) (6 day FT program, extra travel + pick up) $4830* Post Graduate (6 day FT, extra travel, am and pm training available) $4980* * Includes Winter Park/Mary Jane Pass, access to Grand Park Rec Center for Competition Center guided fitness activities, Sports Science program and directed workouts during the week. There is an additional work deposit fee of $400 which is refunded upon completion of volunteer work hours. Click here for details.

Team Jacket  for the upcoming 16-17 season Enroll by October 15th to secure your team jacket size.

item.description: Gran Fondo Mont-Tremblant is a mass participation sporting event that attracts thousands of road bike enthusiasts. The event offers four official routes of 160-km, 125-km, 80-km, 45-km, that cross more than 10 municipalities, designed to allow participants to discover and enjoy some of the most scenic of the region’s landscapes.

item.description: Vélomotion presents the 22th Quebec and Canada Mountain Bike Cups. The competitors will face off during the downhill and cross-country divisions that will take place on the mountain bike trails. Again this year: a sports competition that combines running and biking with a transition area. Also, guided tours of the mountain with a gondola access... View Article
item.content:encoded: Vélomotion presents the 22th Quebec and Canada Mountain Bike Cups. The competitors will face off during the downhill and cross-country divisions that will take place on the mountain bike trails. Again this year: a sports competition that combines running and biking with a transition area. Also, guided tours of the mountain with a gondola access to the summit.

item.description: Collegiate mountain bikers are taking over the mountain to compete in downhill, cross-country, short track and dual slalom racing. Watch them battle it out for the title of champion! Snowshoe Bike Park will be closed for the public during this race event weekend.

item.title: The Vermont Challenge
item.dc:creator: Stratton
item.eventLocation: 5 Village Lodge Rd. Stratton Mountain, Vermont 05155
item.description: Are you up for the challenge? Aug 11 – 14, 2016 Ride Vermont’s premier tour, the Vermont Challenge August 11-14, 2016 The 5th Annual Vermont Challenge is a premier bicycle tour that offers both challenging routes for elite recreational cyclist plus tamer routes for all riders. The routes traverse southern and central Vermont over 2,... View Article
item.content:encoded:
Are you up for the challenge?

Aug 11 – 14, 2016

Ride Vermont’s premier tour, the Vermont Challenge August 11-14, 2016
The 5th Annual Vermont Challenge is a premier bicycle tour that offers both challenging routes for elite recreational cyclist plus tamer routes for all riders. The routes traverse southern and central Vermont over 2, 3, or 4 days including the signature Saturday 1-day Gran, Medio and Piccolo Fondo for all riders on Saturday, August 13. Ride through Vermont’s farm country, rolling hills and quaint historic towns. Stop along the way at great places like Baba Louis bakery, Crowley Cheese, Grafton Cheese and more.

Choose to ride 4, 3, 2 or the one day Fondo Century that is the only Century east of the continental divide offers a mountain resort finish at Stratton Mountain in the true tradition of the grand tours of Europe including people lining the finish with cows bells to bring you home!

Grand Fondo August 13, 2016
The Grand Fondo is the only mountain resort-top Gran Fondo finish east of the continental divide. Sign up for any Fondo level and enjoy dinner at Stratton Friday night 5-8pm and the Vermont Challenge Bike Festival designed to take your riding to the next level with exhibitors focusing on training advice & equipment, nutrition, hydration and more.
Grand Fondo – 106.1 miles. 7,417 ft. ascent. Departs at 7:30am from Stratton Mountain Base Lodge.
Medio Fondo – 66.7 miles. 4,625 ft. ascent. Departs at 8:30am from Stratton Mountain Base Lodge.
Piccolo Fondo – 26.5 miles. 1,685 ft. ascent. Departs at 10am from Bondville Fair Grounds.

Challenge Options
We reconfigured the Vermont Challenge routes creating a 2-day “Valley” & 2-day “Mountain” Challenge. Two amazing experiences for you to choose from or challenge yourself and ride all 4-days for the best experience at a fraction of packaged tour prices.

Route Overview by Day

Valley Stages – out of Dana Thompson Park Manchester:

  • Thursday, August 11: Southern routes out of Manchester – 65, 45 or 30 mile routes
  • Friday, August 12: Northern routes out of Manchester – 58, 40 or 24 mile routes

Mountain Stages – out of Stratton Mountain Resort:

  • Saturday, August 13: Gran, Medio, Gran Piccolo & Piccolo out of Stratton Mountain Resort – 105, 76.5, 45.8 or 26.5 mile routes respectively
  • Sunday, August 14: 58, 40 or 25 mile routes


What’s included in your registration fee:

  • Vermont Challenge stylish jersey
  • Vermont Challenge tech t-shirt
  • Water Bottle
  • Fully stocked Goodie Bag: “The Vermont Challenge Goodie bag blows away all other rides I’ve ridden by far”
  • All Farm to Table lunches each day plus group dinners that are associated with the tour you selected
  • Fully-supported rest stops
  • Tech and sag support
  • Bike tech support each morning
  • $30 of your registration goes to our 6 benefactors:  4 food banks, Stratton Mountain Urgent Care & Grace Cottage Hospital

The Vermont Challenge also offers daily medium & shorter routes for all abilities. To learn more and register: vtchallenge.com

item.title: Tour de Grace
item.dc:creator: Julia Jacks
item.eventLocation: 5 Village Lodge Rd. Stratton Mountain, Vermont 05155
item.description: 17.7 Mile, Scenic Ride Jul 9, 2016 This 17.7 mile downhill ride from Stratton Mountain to Grace Cottage Hospital is good exercise in the fresh air and it’s fun for all ages. Bring the family, bring a team, or come alone and make new friends. Stratton Mountain buses will shuttle riders and their bicycles back to... View Article
item.content:encoded:
17.7 Mile, Scenic Ride

Jul 9, 2016

This 17.7 mile downhill ride from Stratton Mountain to Grace Cottage Hospital is good exercise in the fresh air and it’s fun for all ages. Bring the family, bring a team, or come alone and make new friends. Stratton Mountain buses will shuttle riders and their bicycles back to Stratton Mountain about every 30 minutes. The first 100 participants to register will receive a free t-shirt!

Riders start between 8 and 10 am from Stratton Mountain Welcome Center parking lot. The ride ends at Grace Cottage Hospital. Helmets are required. Mountain/hybrid bikes/tires are highly recommended.

Snacks and water will be available along the route. The ride should take approx. 30min to 1 hour. A shuttle will return you to your car at Stratton. Proceeds will be donated to Grace Cottage.

Breakfast is be available at the Village Market & Deli opening at 7:30am.

Registration:
Register in advance for $25

item.eventLocation: 5 Village Lodge Rd. Stratton Mountain, Vermont 05155
item.description: Hey Girls Ages 8 – 17! You’re invited to spend an action-packed week (or two or more!) with us this summer at American Dance Training Camp’s ultimate Green Mountains dance camp in Stratton, Vermont. Come make new friends and have a blast learning the latest contemporary, jazz and hip hop dance moves from America’s greatest... View Article
item.content:encoded:
Hey Girls Ages 8 – 17!

You’re invited to spend an action-packed week (or two or more!) with us this summer at American Dance Training Camp’s ultimate Green Mountains dance camp in Stratton, Vermont.

Come make new friends and have a blast learning the latest contemporary, jazz and hip hop dance moves from America’s greatest dance choreographers. Dancers of all levels – absolute beginners through experienced performers – are welcome at ADTC.

Our VT home for dance, adventure, sun & summer fun is the the Stratton Mountain School; a beautiful boarding academy located a quarter mile from the base of Stratton Mountain Resort.

And at ADTC, we have just as much fun outside the dance studio as we do in class. You’ll enjoy awesome summer activities like kayaking, paintball, alpine slides, trampolines, zip lining, stand-up paddle boarding and so much more!

Join us for a fun-filled week you’ll never forget. We hope to see you this summer!

P.S. for Parents: You’ll be happy to know that the Stratton Mountain School is the first ski & snowboarding academy to be accredited by the New England Association of Schools and Colleges (NEASC), and is also a certified member of the National Association of Independent Schools (NAIS). And we partner with Stratton to offer parent & family rates at area hotels if you wish to stay nearby while your daughter attends ADTC.

Session 1: June 26 – July 2
Session 2: July 3 – 9
Session 3: July 10 – 16
Session 4: July 17 – 23

Sign Up to Win a Free Week of Dance Camp & Learn More About ADTC – HERE!

item.title: Yoga Teacher Training
item.dc:creator: Julia Jacks
item.eventLocation: 5 Village Lodge Rd. Stratton Mountain, Vermont 05155
item.description: Our training will help you launch your yoga teaching professional career. It is also designed for students who want to find more depth in their practice and understanding of yoga to continue their progression as a yoga student. Many individuals take a teacher training without intention to ever teach. Become certified in 2 weeks! Take... View Article
item.content:encoded:
Our training will help you launch your yoga teaching professional career. It is also designed for students who want to find more depth in their practice and understanding of yoga to continue their progression as a yoga student. Many individuals take a teacher training without intention to ever teach.

Become certified in 2 weeks! Take the 2 weeks consecutively or take Week 1 first and Week 2 at a later time. Days are full and engaging!

 “I believe that a yoga teacher

training (like the one I experienced

with Health Yoga Life) should be

added to the list of must-do things…!”
~ Past Trainee, Nicole H.

At Health Yoga Life we train individuals to be teachers who are interested in helping shape a holistic frontier in their communities. The founders of Health Yoga Life see yoga teaching as a profession of service to others that simultaneously allows the teacher to experience profound human development and spiritual growth. We also recognize that to be a successful yoga teacher requires entrepreneurial skills. Therefore our teacher training also teaches how to build your teaching career and platform so that you can easily share what you love.  In this training, we draw from years of study with some of the world’s best teachers.  We draw upon our Health Yoga Life Coaching techniques to bring out the best in you, because what we know is the more YOU share your true self the more meaningful your teaching will be for you and your students.

Where: Stratton Mountain Resort (retreat like setting)
When:June 25 – July 2, 2016 (Warrior 1) & July 2 – July 10, 2016 (Warrior 2)

Early Bird Savings Ends 04/16/16! Click here for pricing and registration!
Prices include tuition, double accommodation and meals.

THE HEALTH YOGA LIFE 200 HOUR TEACHER TRAINING AT STRATTON WILL COVER:

◊  Vinyasa (power yoga) sequence including, but not limited to: Sun Salutations, Crescent Lunge Series, Standing/Balancing Series, Back Bending Series, Inversions, Triangle Series, Abdominal Series, Hip Opening Series, and Rest

◊  Yoga as philosophy, a modern approach to life

◊  Pranayama and/or breathing techniques used in yoga

◊  Proper posture and alignment

◊  Verbal and physical assisting for correction and safety

◊  Cultivating your voice

◊  Listening as action

◊  Leading with awareness

◊  Starting and building a yoga teaching career

“Thank you so much for an absolutely amazing teacher training. It was such an incredible experience!”
~ Past Trainee, Caitrin O.

To learn more about Health Yoga Life and our yoga teacher training CLICK HERE!

item.title: Grey County Road Race
item.dc:creator: Tina Ward
item.eventLocation: 108 Jozo Weider Blvd., Blue Mountains, Ontario Canada L9Y 3Z2
item.description: The UCI World Cycling tour is entering its sixth season with new events and growing participation. Amateur and masters’ cyclist who are ambitious to compete for the coveted rainbow jersey now get the chance in qualifier events all over the world to win their ticket for the World Championships in Perth Australia (Dates are yet... View Article
item.content:encoded:
The UCI World Cycling tour is entering its sixth season with new events and growing participation. Amateur and masters’ cyclist who are ambitious to compete for the coveted rainbow jersey now get the chance in qualifier events all over the world to win their ticket for the World Championships in Perth Australia (Dates are yet to be decided but likely to be held in October 2016).

Grey County Road Race, on May 27th (Time Trial) and 29th (Road Race), is currently the only North American stop for the UWCT qualifier events. Blue Mountain Village near Toronto in Canada will offer a great experience and challenging courses, both for the time trial and the road race. The organizer Bruce Bird is reigning road World Champion in the 45-49 age group.

The Road Race event consists of 16 separate categories of riders competing in 8 distinct races. The riders are classified into categories as determined by age according to UCI rules (see World Championship Qualification Criteria). All of the riders will be required to carry UCI licenses or race day road permits (available at registration), in adherence with the UCI’s aim to contribute to the international promotion of “Cycling for All” events by applying high criteria in respect both of the organization and the sporting and tourist interest. The purpose of the UCI World Cycling Tour brand is to enable amateur cyclists to battle for a World Champion title at events with the finest organization in the world.

There will be three distances that the riders will complete based on category (see course maps). Groupings have been set up based on expected number of participants each of the age groups along with projected speeds for the groups. More modifications to the groupings may be required based on attendance with the following guiding principles;

  • Groups of less than 80 riders it may be combined with another group
  • Due to the yellow line rule and with safety in mind, no group shall exceed 200 riders
  • If an age grouping exceeds 200 riders, that group will be divided alphabetically by last name; the top 25% of each divided group will qualify for the World Championships
  • Groupings will not be moved between the morning wave and the afternoon wave (if you have a morning start planned you will not me moved into an afternoon start)
  • Final adjustments will be announced 24hrs after online registration closed on the event website and through an email communication to all registered participants
  • Combined groups will be able to differentiated by the UWCT colour coding for of the numbers

All of the riders will begin the race in the Blue Mountain Village Event Plaza. The road race will begin with a 2.7km neutralized section of road leading up the kilometer zero where racing will begin as directed by the Commissaire in charge of each group. The finish line will be located on 4th Line. Blue Mountain Village will be the host location for the event and the base for all activities.

For more details on the event visit greycountyroadrace.com

This Ontario event features two days of racing across a variety of distances. Runners can expect wooded terrain throughout the mountains, as they run from the top of escarpments to the bottom of valleys. The course... View Article
item.content:encoded:
The North Face Endurance Challenge is a series of trail running events that happen in locations across North America. This Ontario event features two days of racing across a variety of distances.

Runners can expect wooded terrain throughout the mountains, as they run from the top of escarpments to the bottom of valleys. The course will keep coming back for more with constant elevation gains and losses in excess of 800 feet. High bluffs and wide valleys provide excellent views of the rolling countryside and will leave runners humbled by both the beauty and the unique terrain that this area has to offer.

item.content:encoded:
East Coast Open Canada Cup

June 24th – 26th , 2016

East Coast Open returns this year at a whole new level as the only Canada Cup Downhill race in Ontario. Don’t miss an action-packed weekend including the Rockstar Energy Kick-off Party, Night Dual Slalom, and the feature Canada Cup Downhill Race with a $6,000 prize purse! UCI points will be on the line for Canada’s most elite DH racers.

For The Event Schedule, Registration Details, division, accommodation options and race rules please refer to the East Coast Open Canada Cup Tech Guide:

  • Tech Guide can be found HERE   eco_techguide2016 FINAL
  • Online Registration to be found HERE    (To be posted)
  • Event Waiver Can be found HERE (To be posted)

Tentative Schedule:

  • Friday – Official Course Training
  • Saturday – Course Training & Seeding runs
  • Sunday – Course Training & Official Canada Cup Race

ECO Night Dual Slalom Race    Friday June 24th 7pm – 9pm

Returning to the East Coast Open weekend is the head to head dual slalom race ! Based on random selection, racers will go head to head down mirrored tracks. The racer with the fastest times will move ahead in a bracket format.

Sponsorship Opportunities: We are looking for industry brands, non-endemics and enthusiastic supporters to get involved with the event. For all the information regarding sponsorship opportunities click HERE

item.eventLocation: 5 Village Lodge Rd. Stratton Mountain, Vermont 05155
item.description: 2016 Stratton Wanderlust Jun 16 – 19, 2016 Wanderlust is a one-of-a-kind festival bringing together the world’s leading yoga teachers, top musical acts and DJs, renowned speakers, top chefs and winemakers, and much, much more — all in a setting of breathtaking natural beauty. We’re talking about fun in the sun and dancing under the... View Article
item.content:encoded:
2016 Stratton Wanderlust

Jun 16 – 19, 2016

Wanderlust is a one-of-a-kind festival bringing together the world’s leading yoga teachers, top musical acts and DJs, renowned speakers, top chefs and winemakers, and much, much more — all in a setting of breathtaking natural beauty. We’re talking about fun in the sun and dancing under the stars. Hiking on peaceful trails and getting your down dog on at the top of the mountain. Sipping poolside cocktails with your friends, and then enjoying a tasty farm-to-table dinner with views of the surrounding mountain peaks.

~Whatever you do, the choice is all yours. That’s Wanderlust.~
#findyourtruenorth Tweets #Wanderlust2015 Tweets

Wanderlust Festival occurs around the globe as a celebration of mindful living. There’s something for almost everyone interested in a healthy, active lifestyle: Meditation, yoga, music, artists and chef — the list goes on. Read More…
